subject: Sales
title: Pain vs. Pleasure
description: Learn Pain vs. Pleasure in one minute.

hook.text: A man ignores gym ads for a year. His doctor flags a heart risk. He signs up that same day.

buildup.text: Humans sprint from pain faster than they walk toward pleasure. Survival wiring demands it.

discovery.text: Sales trainers call it problem agitation. Surface the pain, then position your offer as relief.

twist.text: But too much pain causes shutdown. Push too hard and the buyer freezes instead of acting.

climax.text: The sweet spot is enough tension to motivate, paired with a clear path to resolution.

punchline.text: Find the pain. Show the cure. That's selling.

quiz.question: What happens when you push too much pain in a sales pitch?
options: The buyer freezes and shuts down
The buyer asks for a discount
